name: A-Trader
product_desc:
82% of adults in Tanzania are engaged in savings, but formal access to banking products is only 13.9% as of 2013. Commonly mentioned barriers to accessing finance/formal banking products is lack of physical access, and high minimum balance requirements.

A-Trader is Tanzania's first online/app based trading platform that allows anybody with a mobile phone/internet access anywhere in Tanzania/the world, to buy and sell shares on the Dar Es Salaam Stock Exchange (DSE). It has no minimum balances, and free access for basic accounts.

Even with 40M mobile phone (5M smartphone) and 17M internet users, online/mobile trading is not possible. And with US$96M invested in the DSE coming from foreign entities in H1 2016, real-time access/trading ability is key.

The aim of A-Trader is to remove barriers preventing Tanzanians, and millions more (300M internet and 130M smartphone users) in 25 other countries with legacy stock exchange models in Africa, from accessing investment and savings options.
markets: Financial Services, Stock Exchanges, Trade Platform, Fin Tech

name: Watoto Wetu
product_desc: Watoto Wetu is a Non-Profit Organization created for the advancement in education for the poor, orphaned children in the region of Njombe, Tanzania. Njombe lies in the South of Tanzania, where unemployment is extremely high and most people farm on a subsistence level. Parents pray and hope that by giving their children an education, they will break out of the cycle of poverty. However, they lack even the most basic needs and certainly cannot pay for clothing, food, health care or school fees. Many children are orphans of the AIDS epidemic, and find a home and education through Watoto Wetu. The Bishop of Njombe, is committed to improving the quality of life of all children in the area. Reforestation, self-help vegetable gardens and animal husbandry are also incorporated into this enterprise. Watoto Wetu, is committed to raise funds and provide technical input to support this worthy cause. ► The school names are Secret Primary and Bakhita Secondary, in Njombe, Tanzania.
high_concept: Watoto Wetu means "Our Children" in Swahili

name: Golden Sands Housing Solutions
product_desc:
We reduce Tanzania's 3 million housing deficit by offering affordable prefab homes built in one-tenth of the time that it takes to construct a conventional house. Our product which is fire, damp, earthquake proof and  takes seven days to assemble,  is composed of low cost eco-friendly building material which is more superior than the conventional.

The growing demand for houses is mainly due to the rapid urbanization of the population growing at an annual rate of 5.2 % ;coupled with the high cost of conventional materials which makes houses unaffordable.

Our target demographic are salaried professionals residing in urban cities. Since our segment live in overcrowded high priced rental accommodation caused by bad  urban planning , they are actively in the market for affordable homes and are eligible for mortgage loans. 

We offer immediately available modern homes at affordable prices. This means we give our customers great value for money while also reducing the housing deficit.

name: PowerGen Renewable Energy
product_desc:
We are bringing utility infrastructure to a continent where less than 20% of the population has access to electricity, in a for-profit context. 

We build solar micro-grids to connect businesses and homes in Sub Saharan Africa to reliable, clean, on-demand AC electricity.  A micro-grid consists of a central solar array which is then distributed to the town or village in which the grid is located.  Our micro-grids utilize cutting edge metering and mobile payment technology to enable rural customers to realize the benefits of productive power.

We uniquely combine our mission – to provide access to energy across all of Africa – with technical, on-the-ground expertise and an innovative business model.  With 35 employees, an 11,000 sq. ft. workshop and headquarters in Nairobi, PowerGen is building a local company that is set to have an impact on the energy sector in Africa for years to come.
high_concept: Pioneering electricity service in Sub Saharan Africa
markets: Solar, Emerging Markets, Rural Energy, Renewable Energies

name: docuverter
product_desc:
mage to PDF Conversion

Many people are moving from traditional JPG, PNG and TIF image to PDF formats. Much of this is because of how an image is stored on one's computer. Standard photo formats are designed to shrink the picture by up to 90%, compressing the file to save disk space. However, this compression results in a slight to moderate corruption of the image when it is opened later or with a different program. Because PDF is universal and self-compressing, this is not a common problem with image to PDF conversion. Even better, these images can be incorporated into other PDF documents quickly and easily without sacrificing image quality. This is why having access to a good image to PDF converter can make a big difference in how your images look on a flyer, in a report or as an illustration in a novel. To convert Image to PDF : 1. Select your image (up to 100Mb) 2. Put your email (optional) 3. Click convert 4. Processing 5. Download your pdf file
high_concept: Image to PDF - Convert your Image to PDF Online for Free

name: NINAYO
product_desc:
NINAYO equips and connects African farmers, traders and agricultural input and service providers of all sizes to business opportunities; packaging crowd-sourced data into actionable market intelligence.  In the same way that Craigslist, eBay and Etsy transformed our conceptualization and access to the global marketplace and removed the risk from individuals to becoming entrepreneurs, NINAYO, with over 7,000 active users, is redefining the boundaries of the Tanzanian agricultural market and farmers’ perception of risk.  

NINAYO is a virtual marketplace where large and small agricultural producers can post their products in Swahili or English via internet or SMS.  These posts are searchable by heat map or simple query of agricultural businesses by price, location, type and quantity.  This process is similar to selling a bike on Craigslist - you have much greater success finding the right bike buyer if you share it on the site than simply putting the word out in your neighborhood.
markets: E-Commerce, Data Mining, Agriculture, East Africa

name: FJS African Starch Development Cy
product_desc:
Starch is a major part of food as well as of various industrial products. As it is made from a renewable resource it becomes very significant as a basis for many kinds of products. Increasing world population and living standards require higher volumes and varieties of starch products. The limitation of resources and environmental aspects demand high efficient processes. 

It is used as food, but is also converted chemically, physically, and biologically into many useful products where is used to produce diverse products as food, paper, textiles, adhesives, beverages, confectionery, pharmaceuticals, and building materials. Cassava starch has many remarkable characteristics, including high paste viscosity, high paste clarity, and high freeze-thaw stability, which are advantageous to many industries

Produced by the wet milling of fresh cassava roots where 25% starch is obtained from mature tubers about 10 % dry pulp may be obtained per 100 kg of cassava roots.
high_concept: Invest in the rapid developing market

name: Mitikaz
product_desc:
Mitikaz is an online marketplace aiming to close the gap between sellers and buyers mainly in developing and semi-developed countries. This is achieved by having an abundance of payment methods (including mobile-phone payment options which are estimated to have 1 billion users by 2017). Mitikaz also has the simplest and most consistent experience across devices (computers, tablets and phones) and is integrated with a worldwide delivery partner.
As of now, the site is live. This means registered users can create instant Sale listings, Auctions, and Classifieds. They can browse, search, buy and bid on listed items. Payment can be done through conventional methods (using PayPal or debit/credit cards), bank deposits and for those where these are less accessible, mobile phone payments (e.g. M-Pesa) can be used. Withdrawing funds and account management can be done in the specially made My Mitikaz page.
The entire site is also fully encrypted, and also translated (where available)
markets: E-Commerce, Mobile Commerce, Marketplaces, E-Commerce Platforms

name: Kazeeki
product_desc:
Are you a freelancer developer or designer? Are you tired of navigating multiple marketplaces (Freelancer.com, oDesk, Elance...), sifting through irrelevant projects, and spending hours drafting proposals? Have you ever avoided an RFP because the project was too big to handle by yourself? If so, then Kazeeki was created for you.

Kazeeki is *not* another freelancer marketplace. It's a web application designed to work *with* existing marketplaces by helping developers and designers find, price, and win projects. Kazeeki assists with:
- Creating quotes, proposals, and contracts using customizable templates
- Visualizing project metrics and analytics (effective hourly rate, income, skills used, project durations....)
- Searching for projects across all freelancer sites
- Pricing projects based on similar ones you've completed in the past
- Notifying you of new relevant projects
- Finding other developers or designers to collaborate with on projects

Visit http://bit.ly/1tnHvXJ to help!
high_concept: Helps freelancers find, price, and win projects

name: Juabar Design
product_desc:
Juabar creates charging kiosks powered by a solar
PV for use in rural and urban areas in East Africa that lack access to electricity. Juabar focuses on offering power for devices that facilitate connectivity such as mobile phones, tablets and laptops as well as other small consumer
electronics such as lights and TVs. 

The kiosks are offered to franchisees on a lease-to-own basis as part of the Juabar franchise network. As the Juabar franchise network grows the kiosks will serve as point-of-sale hubs to facilitate additional product distribution across the country, from airtime to solar lights to digital media.

Our vision is a network of franchised businesses, providing energy for connectivity and point-of-sale for last mile distribution in underserved areas.

name: Mdundo
product_desc:
Mdundo is a music service aiming to make music easily and legally available for Africa's 1 billion people. Our service is free to use funded by advertisement which we share with the right owners.

Mdundo collect and distribute a local and unique catalogue and we are currently working with 20,000 musicians from 37 different African countries. Our music service is used by almost 1m active users every month.

There are no central right holders for music in Africa. Mdundo is collecting rights to a unique local library that cannot be acquired from any other parties. This gives Mdundo a unique market position and strong competitive advantage.

name: Off.Grid:Electric
product_desc: Off.Grid:Electric is the world’s first massively scalable off-grid electric company. It exists to provide affordable and reliable energy to communities that currently lack such power. The company utilizes distributed renewable energy to sell power as a service to customers who suffer from an expensive grid, an unreliable grid, or have no electrical grid access at all. We provide 24/7 clean energy to anyone, anywhere. Our aim is to deliver a complete technical, operational and financial model that makes incredibly high quality renewable electrical services affordable to millions of homes.
high_concept: Bright, modern light & electrical services, affordable for everyone.

name: First Access
product_desc: First Access is an award-winning fintech company offering a smart data platform for emerging market financial institutions. For the first time, micro- and SME-lenders have a clear path to a digital future. With an intuitive user experience for digitizing paper-based operations, institutions can collect rich data, monitor trends, and then automate processes as they gain more trust in their data. First Access has leveraged its credit scoring experience to enable incremental change without disrupting day-to-day operations. Financial institutions can grow more sophisticated with data at their own pace, incorporating machine learning insights as they go. Lenders have used First Access credit scores to automate low-risk approvals and decrease underwriting time by 80%. The company has its headquarters in New York City and its Africa regional office in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania.
high_concept: Smart data platform for financial institutions in emerging markets
markets: Analytics, Big Data, Finance, Emerging Markets
locations: New York City, Dar es Salaam
